metadata.dc:title: Forensic Pathology and Geriatrics: a vision of future
metadata.dc:description: At present we are witnessing a progressive increasein the population of the elderly in Westerncountries.This obviously implies a rise in the pathologiesof elderly people as well as deaths thatnot only interest the area of care in the field ofhealth, but also the experts that assist the administrationof justice. We are referring to the Institutesof Legal Medicine and to be more specific,the Services of Clinics and Forensic Pathology.The present study is simply some reflectionsmade out aloud on how the elderly populationconstitutes an area of great interest in Legal Medicineand Forensic Pathology as due to thequantity of work that arises from this situation andthe great number of cases that must be studiedby the Forensic doctor. This tendency, as a resultof the reasons mentioned above, is on the rise.Thus, by way of illustration, some results of astudy carried out (doctoral thesis to be publishedshortly) on some 843 cases of judicial deaths arepresented where the above can be seen
